text: king bumi pond rained for so long he was
the preeminent symbol of his country he
remained an enigma the cultures
outwardly modern monarch with few legal
powers but with the status of a
semi-divine feudal ruler throughout his
reign he enjoyed lavish public affection
yet a true assessment of his popularity
was never possible because of the severe
laws banning any negative comment about
the royal family he ascended the throne
in 1946 after the still unexplained
shooting death of his brother the time
monarchy was weak back then its status
diminished the young king set about
rebuilding its prestige king bumi pawn
presented himself as a caring monarch
interested in rural development a softer
side to the military dictatorships that
ran thailand for much of his reign he
became an indispensable figure of
national unity using his revered status
to reach out to remote areas during the
communist insurgency of the Cold War he
gained a reputation as a mediator during
periods of political upheaval it was
after that that Thailand enjoyed its
longest period of democratic rule
however the rise of this man tax in
China wat a tycoon-turned-politician
proved to be a watershed through
populist policies and slick marketing he
gained unprecedented electoral power but
the brash and ambitious mr. taxon was
too much for the conservative
establishment that surrounded the King
King boom upon himself was clearly
uncomfortable with him he was ousted in
a military coup in 2006 like previous
coos it was quickly endorsed by the
palace pro taxing governments that were
elected after the coup were also forced
from office angering his supporters and
tarnishing the monarchies once
untouchable reputation
in later life king bumi pond became more
remote
he was often hospitalized for his
various ailments he remained a near
sacred father figure for many Thais but
one whose ability to influence events
had faded his legacy is a highly
personalized monarchy that will struggle
to redefine itself now that he's gone
